direction.raw_text: - A DIFFERENT LIFE DISSOLVE TO: 24        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, MASTER BEDROOM - MORNING Close in on Jacks face, bathed in morning light...he opens his eyes...feels something strange... Jack looks down...theres a womans head resting on his chest. A look of confusion crosses his face...trying to remember... did he meet a woman last night...? He turns his head to find a large MUTT sitting faithfully beside the bed, wagging his tail... ...did she have a dog? He looks down at the woman again, craning his neck to get a look at her face.  And then he sees her... ...KATE REYNOLDS... ...now 34 and even more beautiful, a look of utter contentment on her radiant face, sleeping soundly... His head darts around the room - its cramped and lived in, clothes and toys are strewn about, family photos on the dresser, Laura Ashley curtains, a tiny poster bed and a charming little bay window. He instinctively reaches for his Franck Mueller watch on the night stand, but its not there.  Its a Timex Indiglo and it reads, 7:57 A.M... Jack looks back at Kate...he rubs his eyes...maybe its a dream...but nothing changes.  Then, Kate stirs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack jumps as he hears Kate talk for the first time... Suddenly, the door bursts open...A SIX YEAR OLD GIRL, ANNIE, in a little nightgown, walks into the room carrying an 18 MONTH OLD BOY, JOSH, SINGING at the top of her lungs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie places Josh on the bed and then jumps up herself.  She gestures to the dog, patting the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog faithfully jumps on the tiny bed, joining everybody else and leaving very little room.  Annie starts jumping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack looks at this activity like a man at his own funeral.

direction.raw_text: Josh crawls directly up to Jacks stomach, climbing on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said Dad. Thats it.  Jack moves the baby gingerly over, then gets out of bed, stumbling over a baseball bat lying next to it. He picks up the bat...the same Willie Mays autograph bat that was encased in glass in his N.Y. apartment. Frightened, Jack drops the bad, looking down at himself for the first time...hes naked... ...a mortified look on his face as he sees the kids on the bed... ...he quickly grabs a pair of sweat pants and a yellow cardigan off the chair and throws them on... Kate, still half asleep, reaches out her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack turns by instinct.  Kate grabs him, drawing him near.  A look of fear on his face as Kate opens her eyes... Eye contact...Jacks certain hes about to hear her scream...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lets him go as Jack backs out the door... 25        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE LIVING ROOM - SECONDS LATER A garishly decorated Christmas tree sits in the middle of this messy and disorganized living room, a bevy of gifts underneath and four red stockings over the fireplace. Jack darts to the top of the steps...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks back at the bedroom, then at the stairs...quickly heading down the CREAKY steps, still in shock. He grabs an overcoat from a hook by the front door...about to step out when he looks down and realizes... ...hes barefoot.  He glances at a pair of rubber over- boots sitting by the door, slips them on, just about to leave when... He hears the sound of a KEY TURNING in the door lock...Jack looks at the door, not quite sure what to do... The door opens...into the house, arms laden with wrapped gifts, walk BIG ED and LORRAINE REYNOLDS (both 60s), Kates parents.  Big Eds wearing a ten gallon hat and a suede overcoat.  Lorraine has a cigarette dangling from her mouth.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Its such an ancient pitch, but one that Id never switch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause theres no nicer witch than you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...than you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...than you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (speaking quietly to Kate) Happy Birthday sweetheart...I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 72        INT. CAMPBELL MASTER BEDROOM - EARLY MORNING Lucy licking Jacks face.  Jack pushes the dog away...as... The ALARM RINGS.  Kate pushes the button to stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack obliges without question, getting out of bed, putting on a robe and slippers and exiting, still practically half-asleep. 73        INT. KITCHEN - SECONDS LATER Jack walks into the kitchen. He turns on the Mr. Coffee, gets a bottle from the fridge, throws it in the microwave, removes it, and heads upstairs. 74        INT. JOSHS ROOM - CONTINUOUS ...into Joshs room.  Josh is wide awake, standing up in his crib, like a prisoner in a cell. Jack gives him the bottle, pats his head perfunctorily, and then walks out of the room...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (groggy) Time to get up, honey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - HAPPY ANNIVERSARY 75        INT. BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS ...and back into the bedroom to find Kate, sitting on the bed, a wrapped present in front of her and a wide smile on her face. Jack stops, raising an eyebrow at the gift.  He looks behind, as if to ask whether its for him, then back to Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terror on Jacks face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack musters up a smile, then approaches the gift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hesitates, then begins unwrapping the package, revealing... ...a suit, similar in color and style to the Zegna suit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack is overcome with emotion...Yes, its a ZEENA, but this is probably the nicest thing anyones ever done for him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack looks at Kates expectant face, suddenly remembering how truly screwed he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hes sweating bullets...watching as Kate gets a quizzical look on her face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.  Kate looks at him like shes looking into his soul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack stands there, silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That didnt help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack sees a tear run down her face...a pang of guilt on his...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate wipes the tear away but they just keep coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack approaches her, holding out a hand but Kate pushes it away, gets up and walks toward the bathroom... Jack is left standing alone, holding Kates gift...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Happy Anniversary, honey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pushing the gift forward) Before you do whatever crazy stunt youve got planned I want you to open mine...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I should wait...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, open it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I found it at an outlet store.  I know its a knock-off, but I think itll look great on you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (examining the label) Zeena...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tearing up) You really are incredible...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enjoy it, sweetheart...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Youre probably expecting something from me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heres the thing.  I really hadnt planned on giving you your...uh... anniversary gift until tonight. (an uncomfortable smile) You know, anniversarys good all day...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about?  You never wait all day.  You can barely wait until its light out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know that, but...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You forgot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You actually forgot our anniversary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ill fix it.  Ill go out right now and get you something.  Ill make it right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (holding back the tears) Jesus, Jack...Is this where we are now?  Is this our marriage? Suddenly Im the wife who has to drop hints two weeks before her anniversary so her husband doesnt fuck it up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please dont cry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking her head, crying) I dont want to be that, Jack...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 76        INT. FRONT PORCH - MINUTES LATER Jack emerges from the house, steps out onto the porch for some air... He shakes his head, a mixture of frustration and self- pity on his face. He notices Annies bike leaning against the side of the porch, and the bell that Cash gave him sitting on its handle bar. He takes a step toward it, and gives the bell a gentle RING ...he looks around, as if hes expecting someone to appear ...but theres no one.  He RINGS the bell again, louder this time, really trying to attract someones attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.  Finally, he lifts the bike up in the air, RINGING the bell with everything hes got...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull back...Annie in the doorway...looking at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack turns and sees her, gently lowering the bicycle. 77        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE KITCHEN - MORNING Jack is mixing a glass of chocolate milk.  Annie, arms folded, is waiting expectantly.  He finishes, sliding the glass to her. She takes a long sip, puts the glass down, a chocolate milk mustache on her lip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack raises an eyebrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie smiles, impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, a look of confidence comes over Jacks face. For the first time, he seems like a man in control. 78        INT. BEDROOM - LATE AFTERNOON Annie is sitting on the bed watching her mother get dressed. Kate, wearing a silky slip, walks out of her closet carrying two dresses on hangers, a red one and a sexy little black one. Kate holds out the two dresses to Annie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie thinks about it for a moment, taking it very seriously...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate nods.  Shes about to put it on when she looks at Annie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks at her with a raised eyebrow, then nods. Its true.  She puts down the dress and holds out a hand to Annie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate leads her to the makeup table, then opens a lipstick...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate nods then applies some red lipstick to Annies lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate rubs her lips together, showing Annie how to do it.  Annie mimics her Mom, then Kate looks at her Annies beaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A smile from Annie... Pull back to reveal...Jack standing at the door, watching ...appreciating the kind of mother Kate is... 79   OMITTED 80        EXT. LOIRE - NIGHT A small, elegant French restaurant hidden on a tree- lined lower Manhattan street. 81        INT. LOIRE - SAME TIME Jack is wearing the suit Kate gave him.  Its not a Zegna, but he looks pretty damn good. He leads Kate toward the cloak room at this intimate restaurant... He helps her off with her coat.  Kates wearing the sexy little black dress and we can immediately see its effectiveness...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A charmed smile from Kate as she hands Jack her coat. Jack hands the coats over to the COAT CHECK GIRL...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack fakes a SNEEZE, trying to cover up...Kate gives him a pat on the back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes Kate by the arm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads her to the main room. She looks out at the room, elegant tables, French country decor, a PIANIST playing Cole Porter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacks caught for a moment.  Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack puts his arm around her and kisses her on the cheek... 82        INT. LOIRE - A LITTLE LATER Jack and Kate sit at a secluded table, a WAITER standing next to them.  Jacks not even looking at the menu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks at Jack, a mixture of confusion and awe on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate reaches over and pulls down the wine list, reading it upside down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wince from Jack...for a moment there it was almost perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The waiter nods, then walks toward the kitchen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A noncommittal nod from Kate.  Then Jack notices her look over at the pianist, drawn in by the music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A puzzled look from Kate.  Theres nobody else dancing.  There isnt even much room to dance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack gets up and holds out a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks around again, then she smiles. Kate rises, taking his hand.  Jack takes her in his arms, swaying slowly in the limited amount of space, confident and self-assured. The pianist looks up, smiling, appreciating their role in this romantic moment. Kate moves with Jack, following his lead comfortably. They look good together...in sync with each other... People are watching them...some of the men are impressed, others are scoffing, but the women are clearly charmed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack flashes her his most charming smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They continue to dance, in a world of their own... 83        INT. LOIRE - LATE Jack and Kate at the table enjoying a gourmet meal. Jack holds out a fork with a piece of veal for Kate. She takes a bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack takes a scallop from Kates fork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate shoots him a look of curiosity.  Jack looks back at her, sees the trust in her face...He puts down his fork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hears the seriousness in his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods.  Jack searches his mind for the right words. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack looks to her, expecting the worst.  But she just nods reassuringly.  He continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack lets out a small smile.  Now hes the one whos reassuring Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her, staring into her eyes, almost desperate for understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A raised eyebrow from Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles, right there with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate laughs, nodding. A pause, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its as if shes inside his head.  They stay like this for a moment, looking into each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops a moment, considering.  Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack looks into Kates eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles at Jack, a loving, secure smile.  Its been a while.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cmon...cmon...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting to the sky) Cmon, goddamnit, how was I supposed to know the date of their anniversary!?  I never married her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly) Put the bicycle back on the ground...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not bad...I shoulda warned you.  Dad always does something really special for their anniversary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One year he had a solar system named after her...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dont you think thats a little gimmicky?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mom liked it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe theres a jewelry store back at the mall. I could get her a pair of earrings or something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thats good but...you did forget the anniversary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right.  Thats a major oversight... (thinking aloud) So if Im Kate...I cant really afford the finer things, my husbands career is a crushing disappointment to me, Im trapped in suburbia...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he ever take her to the City?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Youre really gettin the hang of this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which do you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The black one...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fightings a part of it, Annie.  You know that, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im not worried, Mom. Hes still learning our ways...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cmere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) Really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now go like this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Youre gonna break a lot of hearts, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look beautiful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (instinctively) Thanks, Catherine...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly to Jack) Jack...can we afford all this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whats the difference? Im taking my baby out for our anniversary, damn the costs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you even know about this place?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Arnie... (insistent) Arnie.  Hell throw you a curve ball once in a while, thats for sure...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well have the tureen of quail breast with shiitake mushrooms to start, then the veal medallions in raspberry truffle sauce and the sea scallops with pureed artichoke hearts...sea scallops, North of the Caspian...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very good, sir.  And may I say those are all excellent selections.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You may... (perusing the wine list) Also, well have a bottle of Lafite, 1982.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Its five hundred and fifty dollars, Jack!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a glass of red wine for each of us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are so not off the hook yet, slick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But Im gettin close, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want to dance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I dont think theres dancing here, Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure there is...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering to Jack) Pretty good for a tire salesman from Jersey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have my moments...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mmmm... (spearing a scallop) ...here, try one of these...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (savoring the scallop) God I missed that taste...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you laughing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need to tell you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it may help us but theres a slight chance it could make things worse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now Im worried...just say it.  Whatever it is well deal with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel like Im living someone elses life...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I used to be so sure about everything, you know?  I knew exactly who I was and what I wanted. Then one morning I woke up and suddenly it was all different...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Worse, you mean...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  Well, maybe a few things.  But mostly just different...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never used to be like this, Kate.  I had it all figured out.  No doubts, no regrets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now...I dont...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me neither.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think its good to be a little unsure about who you are.  Its very human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you always seem so certain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cmon, Jack, you think there arent mornings when I wake up and wonder what the hell Im doing in New Jersey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thats a big one for me, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My office is a dump, I answer my own phone...and youve seen my pay check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your pay check is a disgrace to pay checks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean yes, I help people that need it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess...some of them are probably faking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a laugh, then...) God, sometimes I think it would be so nice not to have to stretch ground beef or maybe drive a car with a CD player...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Imagine having a life where everything was easy...where you asked for things and people just brought them to you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Its wonderful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think about it, too, Jack.  I do.  I think about the kind of person Id be if I hadnt married you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I realize Ive just erased the things in my life Im most sure about.  You, the kids...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good things...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you sure about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im sure that right now theres nowhere Id rather be than here with you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 84        EXT. PENSION - NIGHT The mini-van parked outside a small brownstone right on the square.  Its like something out of a Henry James novel... charming, meticulously maintained, elegant... 85        INT. PENSION, SUITE - A LITTLE LATER The door opens and Jack, carrying Kate in his arms, enters... Jack puts Kate down and she takes in the room, antique furniture...its like walking into another world...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack smiles as he opens a champagne bottle sitting on a silver ice bucket...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles, clinking her glass with Jacks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate saunters into the bedroom, looking at the king- size poster bed, feeling the down quilt.  Jack follows her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate kisses him...when their lips separate, we can see the powerful effect it has on him. Jack looks deep into her eyes, stroking her hair, lost in her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They kiss again, a long soulful kiss.  Then... Jack pulls back, a look of realization on his face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She kisses him, their bodies intertwined...hands caressing ...more and more passionate...then reaches behind her to the light.  The room goes dark...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is so beautiful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know champagne makes me do crazy things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pouring) Ill just full yours up to the top. (handing her a glass) Happy anniversary, sweetheart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I dont know how you did it, hoss, but you pulled it off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im out of the doghouse?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Way out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning to him) You may even get lucky tonight...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Youre so...beautiful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I already told you you were gonna get lucky, Jack...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My god, all this time...I never stopped loving you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a wide smile) Thats all I wanted to hear...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 86        INT. PENSION, SUITE - MORNING Morning sun streams onto Jack and Kate in bed... Kate, in Jacks arms, her head on his chest, a contented smile on her face... Jacks eyes open...adjust to the light.  He looks over at Kate. Theres something different in his eyes...something deeper.  Jack smiles...a broad, Im in love kind of smile. Kate stirs, gently stroking Jacks chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate lifts her head, turning to face Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate lays her head back on Jacks chest, looking at Washington Square through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate lifts her head and looks at him expectantly.  They kiss. 87        EXT. NEW JERSEY STREET - NIGHT The mini-van passes a sign that reads, Welcome to Teaneck. 88        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, VARIOUS - MORNING Annie walking through the downstairs of the house, practicing her violin...its a noise bordering on MUSIC, but not quite... She walks into the kitchen where... Jack stands at the counter in his robe, reading the Newark Star Ledger and drinking a cup of coffee. He lowers the paper, watches Annie with a smile as she strolls through the room playing her violin badly...he goes back to his paper. 89        INT. JACKS CLOSET - MINUTES LATER Jack, still singing, donning his Dockers and short- sleeve oxford... 89A        EXT. CAMPBELL HOUSE - MORNING The front door of the Campbell House... Jack emerges in his work clothes, putting his coat on, a bagel in his mouth... He disappears from frame, the screen door closing slowly behind him... In a moment...Kate appears at the door, a cup of coffee in her hand...she follows Jack with her eyes as he heads to the car. Then...a smile from Kate... In a moment...Jack returns to frame and heads straight into Kates arms... ...a passionate kiss as she leans against the door post...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A smile from Jack as she pats him on the ass and sends him on his way... 90        EXT. BIG EDS - AFTERNOON Jack, pointing to a stack of radials, is standing with a MAN (40s) wearing a pale blue leisure suit and a pair of high top Nike Air Jordans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then, a black ROLLS ROYCE SILVER SERAPH pulls into the lot, its front left tire riding on the rim...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack turns toward the door, but then looks curiously back at the Rolls...something familiar about it... Then...Peter Lassiter gets out of the car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack walks inside... 91        INT. BIG EDS TIRES - CONTINUOUS ...but hes still focused on Lassiter through the window, cant take his eyes off him... He gets to the phone...sees the light for line two blinking ...he looks back outside, sees Kenny approach Lassiter... ...back to the blinking phone light...he picks up the phone... But cant bring himself to hit the blinking light. Then...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mmmm...Jack...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel like I should give you money...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean, my god, Jack you were always good but this...this was... like a porno movie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could stay here forever...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I dont think Id fight you on that one...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have a good day...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the money, theyre hands down the best radial we carry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thinking, then...) Okay, Ill take them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wont regret it... (shouting to Tommy) Tommy!  Set Mr. Conlin up with four B.F. Goodrich G-Force T/As... (looking the man over) ...and give him ten percent off for having the best costume...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (over P.A. system) Jack, Kate on line two! Jack pick up two!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (walking out to Jack) Kates on two, Jack. (on seeing the Rolls) Nice ride...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring at Lassiter) If youre into that kind of conspicuous consumption...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want me to handle him?  I think Im ready...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (over P.A. system) Jack!  Kate still holding on line two...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure...be careful, he looks like a tough negotiator...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Estelle, into intercom) Tell Kate Ill call her back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (into intercom) It sounded pretty important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes his hand away from the phone and walks back outside the store...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into intercom) Im with a customer. Ill call her back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - PETER LASSITER 92        EXT. BIG EDS TIRES - CONTINUOUS ...towards Kenny and Lassiter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack approaches, tapping Kenny on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny nods then heads back inside...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Kenny) I seem to have had some kind of blow out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why dont you let me take this one, Kenny?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, chief.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Peter Lassiter...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) Do I know you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not exactly. Ive seen you on CNBC. (with a smile) You look taller in real life...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 93        INT. BIG EDS TIRED, JACKS OFFICE - LATE Jack leaning back in his chair, behind the desk of his cluttered, cramped office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lassiter, sitting on the little chair across from Jack, an intrigued look on his face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A smile from Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack savors the moment, until...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hes jarred back to reality, a little crestfallen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lassiter nods, then takes a business card out of his wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A smile from Jack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...truth is, Mintz was so busy timing his wifes breathing he didnt see that MedTech needed Global more than the other way around.  Ten days, two weeks tops, they wouldve approached you with an offer, and Id bet anything it wouldve been thirty billion, not twenty nine... (a knowing smile) Problem was, Peter, you had a pussycat running the show. What you needed was a rottweiler.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding) Well, Im impressed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I really am...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, about my car...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. Were going to have to special order that tire. Itll be ready in about two days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This has my office address on it... (thinking, then...) Why dont you drop it off yourself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 94        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, JACKS BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT Kate, sound asleep in bed... Pan across to Jack, his eyes wide open, lost in thought... 95        INT. BIG EDS, JACKS OFFICE - DAY Jack wearing his Zeena suit, sitting behind his desk, distracted, as he listens to HECTOR, 40s, the GUATEMALEN MECHANIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack is shaking his leg anxiously under the desk as he eyes the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack checks his watch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack nods, then...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...I say to her, Margarita, we already have four kids, why do we need more?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But she say she want an even number. I say four is an even number! But she say she want six.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I tell her, Margarita, I just got my green card, I like to sit back and rest a little bit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Hector...do I usually listen to your personal problems?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, Jack, all the time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I have some business that I have to take care of in the city so Im leaving early... (getting up) My advice to you...follow your dreams.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 96        EXT. LASSITER BUILDING - AFTERNOON Jack pulling up to the building in Lassiters Rolls... He gets out of the car, walks to the building, feeling good, confident, stopping to gaze up at the skyscraper...he breathes in deeply, then heads inside... 96A        INT. LASSITER BUILDING - CONTINUOUS Jack enters, instinctively tossing the car keys to the SECURITY GUARD...the guard looks at him like hes crazy... 97        INT. LASSITER BUILDING CORRIDOR - MINUTES LATER Jack and Lassiter walk together...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk into... 98        INT. ALAN MINTZS OUTER OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Past the assistants desk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lassiter doesnt even slow down... 99        INT. ALAN MINTZS OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Its Jacks old office but you wouldnt know it from the decor...lots of country pine, a fabric sofa, and a play pen where the bar used to be.  Jack enters, immediately struck by the difference...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mintz, a confident look on his face, gets up from the desk and goes to shake Jacks hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chuckle from Mintz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another laugh from Mintz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack nods, sits down on the plush sofa, Mintz and Lassiter take the chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacks a little taken aback by the question, not realizing he was walking into an interview... He crosses his legs, trying to get comfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack nods...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack pauses, analyzing the situation...the patronizing questions, the smirk on Mintzs face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Jack stares into their faces, he realizes the extent of his handicap...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops, takes a moment, looking at Mintz and Lassiter then ...a confident smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gleam in Jacks eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A raised eyebrow from Mintz. Mintz and Lassiter follow Jack with their eyes as he crosses the room to the desk, pours himself a glass of water...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacks confidence is throwing Mintz off, but Lassiter appears intrigued...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mintz covers his embarrassment with a smile...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack looks around the office then back to Mintz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A laugh from Lassiter as Mintz sits there stewing, a caught look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A raised eyebrow from Lassiter, but hes game...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lassiters impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Lassiter...nodding his head. Mintz, a plastered-on smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lassiter returns Jacks gaze with equal intensity. In a moment, he turns to Mintz.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...were really more of a boutique operation, as you can see...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But youre not interested in boutique dollars... (a smile) I get it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (seeing Lassiter) Hes expecting you, Mr. Lassiter...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mintz) Alan, this is Jack Campbell...the one I was telling you about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (appropriately deferential) Mr. Mintz.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, call me Alan. We try to cultivate a casual atmosphere around here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: play pen) I can see that, Alan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have kids, Jack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitating, then...) Uh...actually, yes. Two... good ones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thats great... (gesturing to the sofa) Why dont you have a seat?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, Peter mentioned that you were an avid CNBC watcher but didnt say whether you had any actual Wall Street experience?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was a sales associate, at E.F. Hutton.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A broker? Really. And now youre in the tire business?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thats right. And auto supply...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh huh. The retail end, I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh...we actually get about sixty percent of our business from automotive service.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mind if I ask what kind of sales you did last year? Ballpark...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We did one point seven million in total revenue...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh huh...one point seven. And what do you project for this year?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any thoughts at all on that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, Alan, I think were gonna have a banner year. Sales are up almost twenty percent in the first quarter and we just landed a major trucking company account.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really. So youre projecting what, a tad over two million?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thats right. And that would make us number one in our market... (getting up) You mind if I stand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I know our paltry little two million in sales is about what you spend on office supplies in a year.  And I know some regional trucking company account is nothing compared to a sixty billion dollar merger...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im not trying to knock the tire business, Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a confident chuckle) Its okay, Alan. I get it. Im in your shoes, Im thinking exactly the same thing...but heres the thing. Business is business.  Wall Street, Main Street, its all just a bunch of people getting up in the morning, trying to figure out how the hell theyre gonna send their kids to college.  Its just people...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I know people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im sure you do...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (intervening) Lets let the man have his say...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mintz) Take you, for instance...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defensive) What about me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You drink about sixteen Diet Cokes a day. Youre an excellent father, but you feel guilty about the time you spend away from home. You drink bourbon, but you offer your clients scotch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And your wife decorated this office...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He certainly has your number, Alan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning to Lassiter) Youre a little tougher, Peter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For one thing, you like expensive things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling proudly) Thats easy. Youve seen my car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a chuckle) Okay...you smoke Hoyo de Monterreys. Youre a scotch man, single malt, not because its trendy but because youve been doing it for forty years, and you stay with what works. You have two great loves in your life, your horses and this company. You wept openly the day the Dow hit ten thousand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And youre a man who prides himself on finding talent in unusual places...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh? And how would you know that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because Im here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im prepared to do anything it takes to get this job. Start anywhere you need me to start. Ill park cars if I to... (into Lassiters eyes) The biggest part of judging character is knowing yourself. And I know this, I can do this job. Give me a chance, Peter, I wont let you down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mintz) Alan, why dont you show Jack around a bit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Id love to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 100        INT. LASSITER BUILDING CORRIDOR - MINUTES LATER Jack and Alan walking side by side down the hallway... EMPLOYEES passing them by, greeting Mintz, Mintz waving back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn a corner, coming into a deserted section of the corridor. Mintz stops, turning to Jack.  Jack returns Mintzs gaze with a quizzical look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacks a little taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack stands there, staring at Mintz, silent, expressionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, a broad smile from Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now its Mintzs turn to look quizzical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack smiles at Alan one more time, then turns...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack heads down the corridor, whistling a happy tune, leaving Mintz standing there, bewildered.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) ...thats our war room. We did seven major deals last year, three of them hostile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not particularly impressed) Seven.  Really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lets cut the shit, huh Campbell? What, did you go through his wallet or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No matter. That circus act back there may have dazzled Lassiter momentarily but it doesnt do shit forme. Even if you get this job, which I highly doubt, let me warn you, Lassiter loses interest in his pet projects very quickly. Im in the big office because Ive proved myself to him year after year and nobody is going to come in here and start turning the old mans head. Especially not some tire salesman from New Jersey. So you watch yourself and stay away from Lassiter, and maybe, just maybe, Ill keep you on after he gets tired of you. Do we understand each other?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do we?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, you really are different, arent you... (nodding) I mean...wow...I am impressed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good for you. Why shouldnt you protect whats yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I dont think youre hearing me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Im hearing you, Alan. Thats not the problem. The problem is that what you think is yours, is really mine.  And I dont care how low on the totem pole I start, I will get it back... (poking him in the chest) So do yourself a favor and dont get too attached to that view because sometime soon, maybe very soon, you and your French country antiques, your chintz sofa, and your little play pen are gonna be moving out of that office.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, and by the way, you try selling tires for a living.  I promise you, youd starve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 101        INT. CORPORATE APARTMENT - DAY A double door opens and Jack leads Kate into this huge duplex.  Kate looks around, taking the place in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is incredible...marble floors, architectural lines, high tech fixtures, elegant modern furniture... its striking but not at all homey like the Jersey house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kates confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack measures her reaction. Its not good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate just looks at him, in shock. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacks starting to struggle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacks back on his heels...seeing his dream picked apart...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hes frustrated...he pauses a moment to gather himself. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sad chuckle from Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacks taken aback by the intensity of her tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate stands there, wounded...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence.  Kate looks him in the eye  a deep, piercing look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate picks up her bag and walks out of the apartment. 102  OMITTED 103        INT. ANNIES ROOM - NIGHT Annie is in a nightgown, practicing her violin. Jack walks in. Its all he can do to hold back cringing at the missed notes. Annie finishes the piece, lowering the bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie starts PLAYING again as Jack looks at the dresser. She has 20 or so family photos lined up and down its sides... Jack studies them...in every one Jacks face is totally contented.  Jack studies them, looking at his own face. Annie lowers the bow, watching him... Jack turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles, then starts PLAYING again.  He turns back to the pictures... 104        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, DEN - LATE Jack...standing in front of the desk, nursing a drink. He looks at Lassiters business card, sitting on the surface of the desk... He gazes around the room...his eyes coming to rest on a bookshelf...a book... He moves toward it...looking at its spine...its a tattered copy of Vonneguts Cats Cradle.  He pulls it off the shelf, theres something inside...a bookmark... ...a PAN AM ticket jacket sleeve... ...inside...a boarding pass...From: London/Heathrow, To: New York/JFK, 10/4/87. He looks at it...somethings not right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then...a NOISE... Jack turns and sees Kate walking into the doorway, standing there...She sees Jack holding the Pan Am ticket sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quizzical look from Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She continues into the room, leaning against a bookshelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack watches her as she lets out a small sigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles gently as she pictures this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The words are like a warm embrace for Jack...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles lovingly at Jack...she walks over to him, kisses him gently on the forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and heads out of the room, leaving him there, the boarding pass still in hand, staring lovingly at her as she goes... 105        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE MASTER BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT Jack walks into the room... The lights are off, Kate already in bed sleeping. He undresses for bed, unable to take his eyes off Kate. Finally, he lifts the covers and climbs into bed next to her, moving closer to her, putting an arm around her, drawing her in... In her sleep, Kate nestles in Jacks embrace.  He savors the feeling, then closes his eyes as... They lay there...side by side...together...a single person.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome to Xanadu...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pretty incredible, isnt it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Its like a museum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning to Jack) So whats the big surprise? You didnt rent this place for the weekend, did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think bigger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the week?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This place is a perk, Kate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A perk for what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A company called P.K. Lassiter and Associates Investment House uses it to attract new executives...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Youre talking to their new Vice President of Mergers and Acquisitions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about, Jack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im going into arbitrage, honey.  Turns out I have a knack for it.  Ill be making two hundred grand a year plus a hefty bonus and thats just to start.  And, we can live in this apartment practically rent free for as long as we want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can finally afford to move back into the city. In style.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you out of your mind?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I dont think so. This is going to be a better life for all of us, honey.  Well put Annie and Josh in private schools...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Annie goes to a great school.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Im talking about the best schools in the country here, Kate...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack, what could you possibly be thinking? What about my job?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is New York City, its like the needy people capital of the world.  Those Jersey clients of yours arent a tenth as pathetic as the ones you could get here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cutting him off) I cant believe you want to move back into the city.  I thought the reason we left was because we didnt want to raise the kids here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, this is the center of the universe.  If I were living in Roman times, I would live in Rome, where else?  Today, America is the Roman Empire and New York is Rome itself. John Lennon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cutting him off) Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Im detecting a kind of funky tension here...We dont have to live in this apartment. I dont need this...Ill commute...Ill drive to work...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In traffic?  Its over an hour each way?  Thats almost three hours a day.  When are you going to see the kids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kate. Youre not understanding me. Im talking about a great life.  A perfect life. Everything we pictured when we were young. The whole package. You said it yourself, life has thrown us surprises, and so we made sacrifices. But now I can finally get us back on track...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can do that.  I want to do that.  For all of us. I need to do that as a man... (imploring her) Think about it.  No more lousy restaurants, no more clipping coupons, no more shoveling snow...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then get a goddamn snow blower!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dont get a new career without even telling me. Dont take Annie out of a school she loves.  Dont move us out of a house weve become a family in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Dont do that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, youre making this into something its not. This isnt a referendum on our lives, Kate. Its a step forward... (appealing to her) Dont you see?  Im talking about us finally having a life other people envy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They already do envy us, Jack...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very nice. What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mary Had A Little Lamb.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah. A classic...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please dont stop...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From London to New York...? (looking up) I came back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our finest moment, right...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When you got on that plane I was sure it was over.  I left the airport afraid Id never see you again.  And then you showed up the very next day... (a wistful smile) That was a good surprise...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think about you on that plane, about what must have been going through your mind...you sitting there imagining our life together, our life apart...I think about the decision you made...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I was being naive but I believed wed grow old together in this house.  That wed spend holidays here, have g randchildren visit us here.  I had this image of us all grey and wrinkly, me working in the garden, you repainting the deck...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Things change, right? People change... (pausing) If you need this, Jack, I mean really need this, I will take these children from a life they love, and take myself from the only home weve ever shared, and move wherever you need to go.  Ill do that because I love you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you, Jack. And thats more important to me than our address...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I choose us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 106        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE MASTER BEDROOM - MORNING The morning light streams into the room.  Kate opens her eyes.  Jacks not in bed.  A look of curiosity. Then, she hears LAUGHTER from outside. She goes over to the window...opens the blinds... revealing... Jack in the backyard, LAUGHING with joy, playing in the snow with Annie and Josh. Kate watches...a satisfied smile sweeping across her face... 107        EXT. CAMPBELL HOUSE BACKYARD - SAME TIME ...Jack reaches out and snags Annie...she CACKLES in delight... The three of them fall over onto the soft white snow... The laughter from the kids is uncontrollable, Jacks joy is just as palpable... Finally, Annie stops laughing and grabs Jack around the neck, hugging his tight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering in Jacks ear) I knew youd come back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 108        INT. GARAGE - NIGHT Jack walks over to a utility shelf, fishing around until he finds a bag of rock salt...he grabs it, sees its empty... And then he hears it...the sound of a BICYCLE BELL RINGING, echoing through the room. A shudder passes through his body... He turns and sees Annie at the open garage door, sitting on her bike, ringing the BELL. Its an eerie moment for Jack...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Jacks anxious face... 109  OMITTED CHAPTER FIFTEEN  SAYING GOODBYE 110        INT. CONVENIENCE STORE - NIGHT On Jack...crouched down in an aisle of this local convenience store...checking out the bags of rock salt... He looks at the price tag on one of the bags...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the entrance to the store...the door opens, a YOUNG GIRL, 17, enters, an average suburban teenager... She glances at a fashion magazine, picks up a package of gum... From the POV of the cashier, we see the girl approach the counter... On Jack, crouched down in the aisle. He grabs a bag of salt from the shelf, when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack registers the voice...he rises slowly, looking over to the front counter...where he sees... Cash, dressed in a typical chain convenience store uniform, ringing up the teenager... An excited smile from Jack at the sight of Cash...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then...the color drains from Jacks face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack moves toward Cash at the counter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl eyes Jack curiously, then removes a dollar bill from her pocket and slides it across the counter to Cash...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cash reaches into the register, taking out change for ten dollars...he hands the girl $9.35...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl looks at the money, realizing that Cash has given her the wrong change...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl looks at Cash talking to Jack...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl hesitates...Cash turns to her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at him, a moment of decision, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cash ignores Jack, watching the girl as she heads to the door, hesitates a moment, then walks out... A look of disappointment on Cashs face as he reaches into his pocket, pulling out a little notebook... Cash looks at Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cash looks at him, compassion on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack throws six bucks on the counter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack walks determinedly toward the exit. He stops and turns at the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cash follows him with his eyes, a proud look on Cashs face as Jack leaves... 111        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, JOSHS ROOM - LATE NIGHT Jack walks to Josh.  Hes sleeping soundly. Jack gently kisses Josh on the head, careful not to wake him. 112        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, ANNIES ROOM - LATE NIGHT Jack is standing over Annie, kissing her on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She closes her eyes as Jack stands there for a moment looking at her, sadness all over his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally, he turns to go... 113        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE MASTER BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT The clock reads, 11:17.  Kate is already in bed as Jack walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack approaches her, sitting on the bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate nods.
direction.name: direction
